alert.note: Alert for Adams; Buffalo; Dawson; Furnas; Gosper; Greeley; Hall; Hamilton; Howard; Kearney; Merrick; Nance; Phelps; Polk; Sherman; Valley (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 17 at 4:26AM CST until January 19 at 12:00AM CST by NWS Hastings
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM MIDNIGHT TONIGHT TO MIDNIGHT CST WEDNESDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations mainly 5 to 10 inches. Isolated higher amounts to around 12 inches possible. Winds will average 15 to 20 MPH with highest gusts of 25 to 30 MPH, initially out of the northeast but then turning northwesterly Wednesday night. This will mainly be a snow event for the warned area, but some locations mainly along or south of Highway 6 could see a period of freezing rain. * WHERE...Portions of south central Nebraska. * WHEN...From midnight Tuesday night to midnight CST Wednesday night. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Patchy blowing snow and occasionally heavy snow rates could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions may develop in time to impact the Wednesday morning commute, but there is greater confidence in impacts to the Wednesday evening commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...While minor forecast adjustments remain possible, forecast confidence has increased enough that significant snow accumulation will indeed occur.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
